info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 10:29PM EDT until July 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL GUERNSEY AND NORTHWESTERN BELMONT COUNTIES... At 1029 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northwest of Barnesville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Antrim, Flushing, Morristown, Old Washington, Fairview, Salt Fork State Park, Barkcamp State Park, and Piedmont Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
